channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Forum Chatbox
channel.description:
I already know I am in the minority of people who will most likely post here and want a chatbox. For some reason people are really against a forum chatbox and I would love to know why. I think it would be a great addition.
Why I think the forums should have a chatbox/shoutbox: -It allows the users to communicate in a different fashion about nearly anything -People would remain on the forums for longer periods of time instead of posting and then getting off. They would have another reason to stay on MoparScape -Some people (such as myself) do not like IRC.
Disadvantages to a chatbox/shoutbox: -(I need some)
If you think it will take up a lot of space or look trashy, there could be an option to minimize it similar to a section on the forums
If you think the IRC is sufficient, look at the number of the users and guests on the forums compared to the active people in the IRC. The forum chatbox would be much more used and people would spend more time on the site. Also, IRC doesn't work on my computer for some reason and some of the people in there don't even post anymore but take time to be complete assholes in IRC.
I'd love to discuss this more so feel free to post your constructive opinions.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Forum Chatbox
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

amy_webb:

The problem with IRC is no new members are ever accepted because of the community that IRC attracts. The one time i logged onto IRC i wasn’t exactly welcomed with open arms, how do you expect newer members to join and fit in with that attitude? A chatbox would allow members to communicate and not be treated differently because they’re “new” to the community. IRC just proves that having a chat system separate to mopar isn’t beneficial, how do you expect to update IRC to fit standards when people are too intimidated to join?

The difference between IRC and a chatbox in this situation is time, IRC is merely an already established chatbox. Once you get members, moderators, regulars to the chatbox it will be no different, people will be flamed for asking inane questions that are answered in a dozen places etc. As for IRC being hostile, I won’t lie and say that #mopar smells like roses, but in most cases the newer folk that do get flamed are usually people who tend to act with a sense of self-entitlement which just doesn’t belong on IRC. Plenty of new people come and go on #mopar without incident, people just don’t hear about those cases because they aren’t there.

vortex:

the problem with a chatbox that connects to irc is the constant join/part spam that will occur when the users browse the forums

Hence why you don’t use an IRC interface that is stupid, I.E., have a chatbox proxy bot that connects to #moparscape (and #moparscape alone), or have a browser plugin that keeps the connection alive etc. Most IRC clients worth their weight have an option to hide join/part messages anyway.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Forum Chatbox
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

thakillah:

8 yes vs 9 no

In no way is that constructive criticism towards the suggestion at hand.

To the thread: IRC is a very mature and open chatting service that literally anyone is welcome to join. We have a link redirecting to a web applet for the IRC. Anyone can join, and if you at least talk with competence (by this I don’t mean say ‘hello yeah i just ate a doughnut’), then you’ll be able to stay just fine. Have patience as well, IRC isn’t as much of a live chatting service as much as it is you can talk to one person periodically, and then just hang around. When I first joined the IRC channel, I just sat for a bit then just said hello and talked about some cool things in the news. If you have a bit of patience and something to talk about, the IRC is truly a very entertaining program to use when you want to chat. Plus, the #mopar channel is quite active, so if you having something to talk about that doesn’t revolve around candy or something like that, then just start talking. If you have a picture of the inside of a computer, then you’ll be able to talk in #mopar for quite a bit of time.

EDIT: I’m not against the idea of a chat box as long as I could disable it.
